course_title: Advanced clinical skills in musculoskeletal physiotherapy

learning_outcomes.description: Describe the underlying anatomical structures, biomechanical characteristics and underlying rationale for clinical examination and treatment techniques.
Demonstrate advanced assessment and treatment skills in musculoskeletal physiotherapy.
Demonstrate an understanding of risk management principles in the safe and effective assessment of clients presenting problem and in the delivery of treatments.
Understand the ethical issues related to the application of assessment and treatment techniques.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess practical physiotherapy skills in a practical station exam. 

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select a case scenario and deliver a group oral presentation that presents their clinical reasoning, physical assessment and management of the case.

The oral presentations will be delivered in person, with demonstration of physical assessment and treatment techniques relevant to the case.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their presentation independent of AI and MT tools. 

In this course the recording of an assessment (oral/practical) performance has been waived, a record of student performance will be taken by other means such as audio recording or detailed written notes that can be referred to if a remark is required at a later date.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will assess students understanding of course content in an online written exam. This assessment task is to be completed online.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 3(23 Feb - 15 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Preparation for Advanced Skills and Topics in Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy

Students will watch a series of pre-recorded online lectures up to 2 hours in total, and go through reading materials up to 3 hours in total, in preparation for their practical musculoskeletal physiotherapy sessions and interactive discussions on topics of relevance to musculoskeletal physiotherapy.

Students will also have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy Clinical Skills Intensive.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Preparation for Advanced Skills and Topics in Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy

Students will also have the option of reviewing and learning practical musculoskeletal physiotherapy skills through online video instruction for preparation for their Advanced Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy Clinical Skills Intensive.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 4 To Week 5(16 Mar - 29 Mar)
learning_activities.topic:
Advanced Skills and Topics in Musculoskeletal Physiotherapy

Students will learn practical musculoskeletal physiotherapy skills through feedback on assessment and management techniques, and participate in interactive discussions on a range of topics of relevance to musculoskeletal physiotherapy.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
